requirements.summary: Build a structured resume editor UI with required sections and repeatable/reorderable items, including validation and save flow.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can create a new resume, edit fields across the required sections, and save changes.
Work Experience and Education support multiple entries and reordering.
UI validates basic required fields (e.g., name) and prevents saving empty required fields.

file_operations.description: Create the main resume editor page that supports editing Basics/Contact, Summary, Work Experience, Education, and Skills; implement add/edit/reorder for repeating items and local validation before saving.
Add a Basics/Contact editor component (name, email, phone, location, links) used by the ResumeEditorPage; ensure required fields (e.g., name) are validated before save.
Add a Summary editor component with guidance (length/clarity hints) and validation integration for ResumeEditorPage.
Add a Work Experience editor component that supports multiple entries and reordering; used by ResumeEditorPage.
Add an Education editor component that supports multiple entries and reordering; used by ResumeEditorPage.
Add a Skills editor component (list editing + basic checks like empty/too short) used by ResumeEditorPage.
Implement deterministic serialization/deserialization between the editor’s structured model (including repeating items) and the backend Resume.sections representation.
Create React Query hooks for resume CRUD (list, detail, create, update, delete) and caching/invalidation to support saving from the editor.
Create a small reusable component to display validation errors consistently across the editor sections.

requirements.summary: Add a live, print-friendly resume preview with browser print/PDF export.
acceptanceCriteria: Preview updates immediately when the user edits the resume.
Preview layout is print-friendly (reasonable margins, no app chrome in print where practical).
An "Export" action opens the browser print dialog for saving as PDF.

file_operations.description: Create a preview page that renders the resume in a clean editorial layout; ensure it can render from either saved backend data or the editor’s in-memory state to enable live updates.
Create a print-friendly preview renderer component with strong typographic hierarchy and section formatting; used by ResumePreviewPage and optionally embedded alongside the editor.
Add an Export action that triggers the browser print dialog (window.print) from the preview context.
Add print styles (e.g., @media print) to hide app chrome/navigation and set reasonable margins/typography for PDF export.

requirements.summary: Provide a coaching UI to run deterministic coaching for a resume and display grouped suggestions.
acceptanceCriteria: User can run coaching on a selected resume and see a list of suggestions grouped by section/category.

Suggestions are generated from deterministic rules (e.g., detect missing metrics in experience bullets, overly long summary, missing dates, inconsistent capitalization/punctuation, weak verbs, skill list too short/too long).
Coaching results are reproducible for the same input and do not call any third-party LLM or API.

file_operations.description: Create a Coaching page that triggers a coaching run for the selected resume and renders results grouped by section and category; do not call any third-party services.
Create a reusable suggestions list UI that groups suggestions by section/category and presents actionable messages.
Create React Query hooks to run coaching and fetch coaching results for a resume; handle loading/error states consistently.

requirements.summary: Implement the application shell, navigation, and resume list workflows using React Query and consistent loading/error states.
acceptanceCriteria: Resume List shows all user resumes and allows opening, duplicating, and deleting a resume.
All data operations use React Query with clear loading indicators and error messages.
Navigation works without broken routes/pages and preserves selected resume context where appropriate.

file_operations.description: Create the top-level app with routing/navigation for Resume List, Resume Editor, Preview, and Coaching; require login before showing application data. Use the authorization component’s frontend guidance for authentication flow. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create an application shell with header/nav and an outlet area for pages; integrate consistent loading/error UI patterns.
Implement login/logout UI using Internet Identity and clear React Query cache on logout per the authorization component guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement first-login profile setup (ask for name) driven by getCallerUserProfile/saveCallerUserProfile; avoid modal flash using the authorization component guidance. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add React Query hooks for current user profile and role checks needed for gating the app and showing the user’s name; follow the authorization component guidance for loading state correctness. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create the resume list page with actions to create, open, duplicate, and delete resumes; show empty state when none exist; use React Query for all reads/writes and handle loading/errors.
Create a list row/card component with open/duplicate/delete actions and consistent styling/disabled states during mutations.
Create a shared loading state component used across list/editor/preview/coaching views.
Create a shared error state component that can render friendly messages for canister failures (including authorization failures) and offer retry where appropriate.

requirements.summary: Define and apply a cohesive professional editorial theme (non-blue/purple primary) consistently across the app.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistently applied across list, editor, preview, and coaching views.
Primary palette is not blue/purple; overall look is professional and readable.
Forms and preview have strong typographic hierarchy and accessible contrast.

file_operations.description: Define global theme tokens (CSS variables) and base typography/spacing for an editorial look; set a non-blue/purple primary color and ensure accessible contrast across components.
Adjust Tailwind theme extensions if needed to support the editorial palette/typography and ensure consistent spacing/typography utilities used by pages.
Apply the theme consistently in the shell (header, nav, page container spacing, typographic hierarchy) so all pages inherit a cohesive look.
Ensure the preview uses professional typographic hierarchy and print-friendly styling aligned with the global theme.

requirements.summary: Add and display generated static image assets (logo and empty-state illustration) in the app shell and empty states.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed in frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
Logo is shown in the app header/shell.
Illustration is used in an appropriate empty state (e.g., no resumes yet) without impacting core functionality.

file_operations.description: Add the generated logo asset at the exact required path: frontend/public/assets/generated/resume-coach-logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add the generated empty-state illustration asset at the exact required path: frontend/public/assets/generated/empty-state-illustration.dim_1200x800.png.
Reference and display the logo from frontend/public/assets/generated/resume-coach-logo.dim_512x512.png in the app header.
Use the illustration from frontend/public/assets/generated/empty-state-illustration.dim_1200x800.png in the “no resumes yet” empty state.
